rationale: Information technology is a relatively new comprehensive term that describes the entire range of information generation, storage, transmission, retrieval, and processing. Most organizations in the industry, business, non-profit organizations, and government departments now rely heavily on their information systems (IS) and information technology (IT). The information system collects, stores, and disseminates information from the organization's environment and internal operations to support organizational functions and decision-making, communication, coordination, control, analysis, and visualization. Therefore, the knowledge about the various applications areas of Information Technology including practical skills acquired through the laboratory will help students when he/she will be working with information systems. At the end of the course, students will be able to comfortably work on computers, install and configure OS, connect it to external devices, protect information and computers from basic abuses/attacks. This course is therefore so designed that the students will be able to apply the concepts of IT systems as and when required.
competency: Apply concepts of Information Technology in various educational, business, and industrial application areas.

courseOutcomes.description: Appraise the Information technology systems for various educational, business, and industrial applications.
Examine basic logic gates for designing digital logic circuits.
Configure features of different Operating Systems for various applications.
Demonstrate communication between two computer systems on a network.
Analyze different parameters of computer network- its communication cable/devices, topology, and addressing system.
Appraise information security for data protection and cyberattacks in network communication.

practicalExercises.description: Identify specifications of various types of computer systems available in your institute
Install any two freeware or open-source software/tool by using Google Chrome/Mozilla Firefox/Microsoft Edge web browser.
Demonstrate participation in any three Digital India Platforms from the following to survey Digital literacy. Digital India Platforms: BHIM, Digi-Locker, e-rupi, m-parivahan
Convert given decimal number into another (HEXADECIMAL, OCTAL, DECIMAL, BINARY)
Verify the truth table of basic logic gates.
Verify the truth table and digital logic circuits of basic logic gates using NAND gate.
Design digital logic circuit functions of basic logic gates with the help of the universal gate-NOR Gate.
Demonstrate Windows-10 Operating System in a virtual machine using VMWare or VirtualBox.
Update the Operating System by using the recommended Setting from the Control Panel.
Install a given Linux Operating System by using VMWare or VirtualBox.
Install anyone from the given freeware application software/tool on your PC (Adobe PDF, notepad++, VLC media player, Skype)
Install given Open-Source application software/tool to your PC. (LibreOffice/Open Office)

Identify different aspects of the network in your department lab by following Parameter's consideration. (1) Types of Cables (Twisted-pair, Coaxial, Fiber Optics) (2) Topology (Bus, Mesh, Star, Ring, Hybrid) (3) Network Type (LAN, MAN, WAN) (4) Ethernet Cable (Color code, Straight Cable, Cross Cable)
Prepare a LAN cable with the help of a crimping tool.
Demonstrate following Networking Commands for troubleshooting. Commands: ping, traceroute, hostname, netstat, nslookup, route
Identify your Desktop/Laptop IP Address by the following. (1) Ipconfig command (2) Default/Manual Network & Internet setting
Identify specifications of the various network connecting devices at your Institute's Lab.

Install any three peripheral devices from the following in your Desktop/Laptop. List of Peripheral Devices: Computer Mouse (Wired/Wireless), Webcam, Microphone, Digital Camera, Scanner, Printer, USB Flash Drive, Smartphone or Tablet Computer Storage Interface, CD/DVD Drive
Connect two computer systems without using any connecting device (use cross cable)
Compile various cyber incidents by visiting the site https://cert-in.org.in/.
Analyze suspicious files and URLs to detect types of malwares by using https://www.virustotal.com/
Prepare a document by using various digital platforms, newspapers or any social media platform to identify cyber-crimes that have been done in your city.

performanceIndicators.indicator: Analyze and identify suitable approach for problem solving
Prepare a report/presentation for given problem

hardware: Computer System (Desktop/Laptop) with minimum configuration: Operating System: Windows 7 or later version, Linux (Red Hat, Fedora, Ubuntu), RAM: 2 GB (4 GB preferable), HDD: 250 GB (500 GB preferable), MS-Office: 2010 (2016 preferable)
Crimping tool, RJ-45 connector (male-female), Twisted pair cable

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Demonstrate working as a leader/a team member

unitOutcomes.description: Describe Information System and its components
Describe the anatomy of a computer system
Utilize the Internet for various applications

topics.title: Importance of information technology in the modern era
Google Search Engine and Internet Applications
subtopics: Applications of Internet Digital Platforms (BHIM, Digi-Locker, m-parivahan, NSDL, Digital Gujarat, passport seva, e-rupi)

unitOutcomes.description: Convert Binary numbers into different number systems.
Classify Basic Logic gates and Universal Gates
Design simple digital logic circuit function using basic universal logic gates.

topics.title: Introduction to digital computers and number system
Working of Logic gates
subtopics: Working of Universal Gates - NAND Gate
Working of Universal Gates - NOR Gate

topics.title: Simplification of basic logic gates using Universal gates (Both NAND and NOR)

unitOutcomes.description: Explain the functions and services of OS.
Explain the different types and purposes of the operating system.
Install Windows/Linux Operating System using a hypervisor.
Differentiate between licensed and freeware software.

topics.title: Windows & Linux Operating System
subtopics: Microsoft Windows OS (History Basic Features, Current State of OS)
Linux Operating System (Architecture, Components of Linux System, Kernel Mode vs User Mode, Basic Features)

unitOutcomes.description: Explain the basic terminology- Transmission modes, serial and parallel concepts of an information communication system
Classify the concepts of Modulation & Multiplexing for Digital Communication
Describe various wired media for digital communications.
Explain OSI Model and its layers for data communication.
Compare various computer network topologies and types of networks.
Explain use of IP addressing system, DNS, communication devices in Internet and Intranet.
Describe functions of Networking Devices

topics.title: OSI Model
subtopics: Name of Protocols supported at each layer
Name of Hardware supported at each layer

topics.title: Network Topologies and Types
subtopics: Network Topologies - Bus, Mesh, Star, Ring, Hybrid
Types of Computer Networks - LAN, MAN, WAN

topics.title: Network Addressing and Services
subtopics: Classful addressing scheme, Address space, notations, netid, hostid
DNS - Introduction, Need, Domain Names & its types
Internet & Intranet - URL, Internet, Intranet, Comparison between Intranet & Internet

topics.title: Networking Devices (Types & use)
subtopics: Hub, Switch, Router, Bridge, Gateway, Modem, Repeater, Wireless Access Point, NIC

unitOutcomes.description: Explain concepts of Information Security for Data Protection.
Classify various cyber-attacks.
Describe cyber laws for data protection and IPR

topics.title: Information Security Fundamentals
subtopics: Definition of various terms of Information Security
Cryptography, Vulnerability, Threat, Attack, Encryption, Decryption
The Principles of Security & Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability (CIA triad)

topics.title: Cyberattacks
subtopics: Introduction of common types of attacks (Malware, Man-in-the-middle attack, Denial-of-service attack, SQL injection, Zero-day exploit, Phishing, Password cracking)

studentActivities: Prepare a portfolio for the Digital India platform and identify digital services for Indian citizens
Give a seminar on latest technologies & applications in demand
Identify the existing network structure of your home
Prepare a case study on cyber-crime
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/subtopics
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature are to be given to the students for self-learning but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students for using data manuals

microProjects.title: Operating System
microProjects.description: Install any flavor of the Linux Operating System by using the virtualization Software (VMware/virtual box).

microProjects.title: Networking
microProjects.description: Prepare a report of various Network connecting devices existing at your home/Institute Lab.

microProjects.title: Information Security
microProjects.description: Prepare a case study of various cyber-attacks in the current marketplace.
